definition: guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
a kite with cut string (idiom); fig. gone beyond recall

sentences.english: Hereby, the learners of Guzheng should make great efforts to push forward the art of Guzheng music.
sentences.chinese: 箏樂藝術在習箏人數的不斷擴增中得到傳承和發展。

sentences.english: The Chaozhou zither is one of its large genres.
sentences.chinese: 潮州箏就是其中的一大流派。

sentences.english: Guzheng, also called Chinese zither, is one of the oldest Chinese musical plucking instruments.
sentences.chinese: 箏，又稱爲古箏，是中國最古老的彈撥樂器之一。

sentences.english: He was very good at playing the Zheng, a plucked string instrument. But he also behaved foolishly sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 他的箏彈得非常好，但有時會作些傻事。

sentences.english: The rhyme as a Zheng music of Shaanxi Province, Mr Zhou Yuguo composition.
sentences.chinese: 《鄉韻》作爲一首陝西箏曲，由周煜國先生作曲。

definition: to manner of dancing/to walk around
Yao ethnic group of southwest China and southeast Asia/surname Yao
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
variant of 弦/bow string/string of musical instrument/watch spring/chord (straight line joining two points on a curve)/hypotenuse
(bird species of China) swan goose (Anser cygnoides)
